nodes.label: HTML
nodes.description: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser. It defines the structure and content of web pages.

nodes.label: CSS
nodes.description: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is a stylesheet language used to describe the presentation of a document written in HTML. CSS describes how elements should be rendered on screen, on paper, in speech, or on other media.

nodes.label: JavaScript
nodes.description: JavaScript is a programming language that enables interactive web pages. It is an essential part of web applications, and the vast majority of websites use it for client-side page behavior.

nodes.label: Frameworks
nodes.description: JavaScript frameworks are collections of JavaScript code libraries that provide developers with pre-written code for routine programming tasks. Popular frameworks include React, Vue, and Angular.

nodes.label: Backend
nodes.description: Backend development refers to server-side web application logic and integration. Backend developers write code to connect the web application with database services and ensure the server, application, and database communicate efficiently.

nodes.label: Databases
nodes.description: Databases are organized collections of structured information, or data, typically stored electronically in a computer system. They allow for efficient retrieval, manipulation, and management of data.
